331 come with no following of soldiers, and under arms3 Ι were alone, were cruel Love not at my side. Him, even should Ι wish, I ean nowhere dismiss; ere that, Ι shall be divided from my very self. And so, you see, it is Love, and moderate wine eoursing through my temples, and a chaplet falling from my perfume-laden hair, that are my escort. Who would tremble before arms like these? Who would not go to face them? The hours of night are going; away with the bar from the door!

49 Am I deceived, or did the post sound with the turning of the hinge, and was that the hoarse signal given by a shaken door? Ι am deceived-—it was only the beating of a gusty wind upon the portal. Ah me, how far has that breeze borne away my hope l If thou rememberest well thy stolen Orithyia, Boreas, come hither, and beat down with thy blast these deaf doors! Through all the city there is silence, and, wet with the crystal dew, the hours of the night are passing; away with the bar from the door!
